roll in.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to happen or arrive in large numbers or quantities
roll in.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: As the result of our appeal, the money came rolling in.
roll in.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to arrive, especially later than usual or expected
roll in.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Chris finally rolled in at about 4:00 am.
roll in.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if mist, clouds etc roll in, they begin to cover an area of the sky or land
roll in.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Fog rolled in from the sea.
roll in.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if money or orders are rolling in, they are arriving in large quantities
roll in.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Orders are rolling in from all over Europe.
